abstract: Editorial notes major copyright case argued before Supreme Court that tests Congressional power to expand copyright protection against First Amendment interests in having older works remain in the public domain; charges that in the interest of free expression, Congress should not restore copyright protection to works that have been in the public domain for decades.
snippet: A strong and convincing lawsuit challenged Congress’s ability to restore copyright protection to foreign works that had been in the public domain for decades.
lead_paragraph: A strong and convincing lawsuit challenged Congress’s ability to restore copyright protection to foreign works that had been in the public domain for decades.
